meanings.definition: A private meeting or secret assembly.
meanings.sent1: The family held a conclave to discuss the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The conclave of witches gathered under the full moon.
meanings.sent3: The conclave of squirrels in the treehouse was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The conclave of shadows whispered secrets in the night.
meanings.sent5: The conclave of detectives solved the mystery in record time.

meanings.definition: A gathering of cardinals for the election of a pope.
meanings.sent1: The conclave in Vatican City was a historic event.
meanings.sent2: The cardinals entered the conclave to choose the new pope.
meanings.sent3: The conclave of birds chirped loudly in the early morning.
meanings.sent4: The conclave of stars shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The conclave of students elected their class president with great excitement.

meanings.definition: A meeting or gathering of a select group.
meanings.sent1: The conclave of artists showcased their work at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The exclusive conclave of scientists shared their latest discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The conclave of flowers bloomed beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The conclave of books on the shelf seemed to whisper stories.
meanings.sent5: The conclave of chefs prepared a feast fit for a king.
